# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is an implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width && !isempty(result)
            result *= "\n"
        end
        
        result *= " $word"
    end
    
    return result
end
```

Here's an example usage of the function:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit"))
```

In this example, `text_width` is set to 10. As a result, the string will be wrapped after every 10 characters:

```julia
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet, consectetur
adipiscing elit
```
